title: Scope
body: The provisions of this chapter shall be used in conjunction with Chapters 7 through 13 and shall apply to the alteration, addition and change of occupancy of existing structures, including historic and moved structures, as referenced in Section 301.3.2. The work performed on an existing building shall be classified in accordance with this chapter.

title: Compliance With Other Alternatives
body: Alterations, additions and changes of occupancy to existing structures shall comply with the provisions of Chapters 7 through 13 or with one of the alternatives provided in Section 301.3.

title: Work Area
body: The work area, as defined in Chapter 2, shall be identified on the construction documents.

title: Structure Seaward of a Coastal Construction Line
body: Structures located seaward of the coastal construction line shall be designed to resist the predicted forces of a 100-year storm event in accordance with Section 3109 of the Florida Building Code, Building.

title: Dangerous Buildings
body: When an historic building is determined as dangerous, no work shall be required except as necessary to correct identified dangerous conditions.

title: Scope
body: Level 1 alterations include the removal and replacement or the covering of existing materials, elements, equipment, or fixtures using new materials, elements, equipment, or fixtures that serve the same purpose.

title: Application
body: Level 1 alterations shall comply with the provisions of Chapter 7.

title: Scope
body: Level 2 alterations include the addition or elimination of any door or window, the reconfiguration or extension of any system, or the installation of any additional equipment; and shall apply where the work area is equal to or less than 50 percent of the building area.

title: Application
body: Level 2 alterations shall comply with the provisions of Chapter 7 for Level 1 alterations as well as the provisions of Chapter 8.

title: Scope
body: Level 3 alterations apply where the work area exceeds 50 percent of the building area.

title: Application
body: Level 3 alterations shall comply with the provisions of Chapters 7 and 8 for Level 1 and 2 alterations, respectively, as well as the provisions of Chapter 9.

title: Scope
body: Change of occupancy provisions apply where the activity is classified as a change of occupancy as defined in Chapter 2.

title: Application
body: Changes of occupancy shall comply with the provisions of Chapter 10.

title: Scope
body: Provisions for additions shall apply where work is classified as an addition as defined in Chapter 2.

title: Application
body: Additions to existing buildings shall comply with the provisions of Chapter 11.

title: Scope
body: Historic building provisions shall apply to buildings classified as historic as defined in Chapter 12.

title: Application
body: Except as specifically provided for in Chapter 12, historic buildings shall comply with applicable provisions of this code for the type of work being performed.

title: Relocated Buildings
body: RESERVED

title: Scope
body: Retrofitting of buildings, as defined in Chapter 2, includes work of a voluntary nature for the purposes of improving the ability of the building or building elements or building components to better serve the purpose for which they were originally intended or the purpose that current building codes intend. Retrofit work shall not include repair work as defined in Chapter 2 and described in Chapter 4.

title: Application
body: Retrofitting of existing buildings shall comply with the provisions of Chapter 17 of this code.
